benchmark_details.name: SylloBio-NLI
benchmark_details.overview: SylloBio-NLI is a novel framework for evaluating large language models on biomedical syllogistic reasoning by leveraging external ontologies to instantiate diverse syllogistic arguments.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To advance the availability of resources for biomedical syllogistic reasoning and evaluate the capabilities of state-of-the-art NLI models.

data.source: A specialized dataset generated using Reactome, encompassing natural language syllogistic arguments.
data.size: 12,098 entity-gene names and total of 211,840 instances
data.annotation: Automated generation leveraging domain-specific ontologies and thesauri.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated by comparing predictions to annotated labels.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better reasoning capabilities of the LLMs.
methodology.validation: Performance was validated through extensive experiments comparing zero-shot and few-shot prompting.
